1142.content:
"There now just to wait for the spider!" Tracer triumphantly having saved a prominent politician from the Widow's trap. She sat in the window watching Widowmaker scope on the door the politician was expected to leave. After twenty minutes had passed the Widow turned her site towards the nearest window, landing on Tracer's position. Tracer quickly waved before blinking out of a bullet's trajectory.
She sped out the back and around the sniper so she may taunt her purple rival.
"You missed!" Lena taunted in a sing-song voice. "You would think by now you'd be used to my lead." She further jested.
"You saved the bot?" Widow asked not turning around.
"Of course I have! It's what Heroes do!" Tracer responded as she blinked in front of the blue woman. As soon as the blue faded the cunning sniper did two things simultaneously she opened fire spraying bullets into the space Tracer had recently claimed and shot a gas mine to the spot Tracer previously stood.
"You got me good!" Tracer said between coughs and closed eyes as the gas faded. Lena had figured she'd be gone when she opened her eyes and chased after the shadow she briefly saw disappear in an alley. Lena knew the plan and pressed a button a certain gorilla had told her to when the time had come.
"I'm on my way!" A lovely voice projected from a speaker in her accelerator.
"Thanks, love." Tracer said as she ran. As she approached the alley Widow launched from below shooting at her position, just as planned Lena blinked towards the sniper as a gorilla grabbed the sniper by the arms. The impact from the gorilla changed her trajectory and loosened a piece of wood that must have been caught in her belt.
"Unhand me you monkey!" The sniper said as she landed with the "monkey"
"I don't think so..." Lena stopped paying attention, clearly Winston had her handled for the moment. Lena retrieved the sniper's gun that had landed on the edge of the roof. Lena noticed a shattered box in the alley below.
"Winston, we might want to have Mercy take a look at her ankle before leaving her to rot."
"Understood." Came the deep voice. A jet swooped in on the opposite side of building. "You ready to go Lena?"
"Just a sec Winst!" Lena turned around, sniper's gun in hand. As she jogged towards the jet the wood Widow had dropped caught her eye and impulsively she picked it up. As soon as she'd grasped it she'd paused as the wand touched her mind filling it with information about itself. "I wonder if Widow knows about you..." Lena silently said to the Swap Wand as she pocketed the stick and continued to the jet.
As Lena stepped into the jet she was greeted. "Good job Oxton!" It was Pharah, "I'd feared we'd need cavalry for the cavalry." she jested.
"You know full well Tracer can handle Widowmaker, she's practically studied her." Soldier called from the cockpit.
Widow was bound to a chair in the back of the jet, she was staring daggers at all around her. Winston had already reclined in a hammock hung in the corner of the room.
"Thanks for the welcome guys." Lena replied to the room. "I'm beat." She stated as she plopped into a seat and relaxed as if she may catch a quick nap. That was her plan at least, but a recent event brought up some tantalizing hypotheticals...
1142.title: Tracer

choices: Find more people to swap with.
11421.content:
Much as she wanted to ponder any number of possibilities, there was one thing that asserted itself before she could do so. Her eyelids. They fell heavy as could be the moment she sat down, wand still tucked in her arms. She wasn't given much time to dream of anything, even if the return trip had taken a fair bit of time. As far as Tracer cared to tell, it was a few moments between her sitting down to rest up, and Pharah nudging her as she walked down the ship's ramp, helmet in her hands.

Within seconds Tracer had sprung to her feet, checked that she had both of her pistols, and also started making the departure trip. She picked up the pace a bit to catch up with Winston, who was escorting Widowmaker off the ship and to their holding location. As they walked, Tracer contemplated something witty to say if Amelie tried anything out of line, but wasn't given the option.

"I'm curious, Amelie," Winston said, breaking the trio's silence. "What exactly is it you were after, anyway?"

Widowmaker let out a few choice words in French. Tracer didn't need a translator to know that know of them were friendly terms.

Lena chortled, and shook her head, "And here I thought French were s'pposed to be the language of love, love?"

Another string of what she could only presume were vulgarities left Widowmaker's lips.

"I suppose it was too much to hope you might be open about it," Winston mused.

A light bulb flickered on in Lena's head, and in an instant she had recalled her way back up the ramp. Winston stopped, still holding onto Widowmaker as he did, and turned to peer back into the ship.

"Lena?"

Tracer didn't hear him. She was too busy zipping around the ship in search of the item she had acquired from the museum earlier. Or rather, that Widowmaker had acquired from the museum, and that Tracer had acquired from her. All the while she silently snickered to herself, verbally patting herself on the back.

"Language of love, love. Oh that was a good 'un," she mused, finally picking up the wand from her seat. She gave it another look over, and pondered a bit more. "I'll have to remember that 'un. Oooo. Maybe next time I can add a fake accent'r somethin'. Practice enough, bet I can sound jus' like 'er." Another laugh escaped her, "Bet Emily might like that." Pocketing the wand before she could watch it glow, Tracer began the return to Winston, continuing her conversation with herself.

"Oh look at me, ze evil snipor of Talon," she said, doing her best to mimic Widowmaker's voice and tone. She stopped in her tracks, peering around. She could have swore it sounded like Amelie was right there. "What was..."

She stopped mid-sentence, bringing a hand to her throat. She certainly hadn't tried to do an impression there, but she had. In fact, she was a dead ringer for Widowmaker, right down to the accent.

"How did...What..." She looked around, before finally pulling the wand back out of her pocket. "Did you do this?" Feeling a bit panicked, she rushed back down the ramp, to Winston.

"Winston, somezing has," she said, pausing to catch her breath.

"There you are Lena! What's the matter?" the scientist asked, Widowmaker still held in place with one hand.

Tracer gave him a confused look. "You can't tell? Don't I zound a bit different to you?"

Winston canted a brow, shaking his head. "You sound the same as you always have Lena." Tracer peered down at the wand, and then at Widowmaker.

"Wot'r you looking at ya git?" the purple woman said crossly.

"Was there something you forgot on the ship?" Winston asked.

Tracer looked back down at her hands, clutching the wand tightly and tucking it away. "Ah, no. Zere was nozing. It was nozing, I mean. I left one of my pistols behind, zat is all."

Widowmaker turned to sneer, and make a crude remark, but before any words left her mouth, her eyes zeroed in on the wand. "What in the world'd you d-..." She was cut off by Winston pushing her forward, having accepted Tracer's excuse. As the pair walked, Amelie turned to glare daggers at Tracer, who replaced the wand in her pocket.

She stood on the ramp of the ship, considering what to do now.
11421.title: A Fling with the French Language

choices: had unknowingly been changed by Emily.
talked the wand out of Emily's hands.
114213.content:
As Tracer's mind raced, her body seemed to operate on autopilot. Her legs moved down hallways she was well acquainted with, but her mind was miles away, trying to parse out just exactly what had happened. In her head she still heard herself as she had always known. With that, as many people had told her at least, overdone accent from London. It was all she had ever known, it was where she had grown up.

Yet when she stopped to think about it, none of it truly came to her. When she tried to remember growing up, she remembered Paris. The beautiful colors of each season, the wonderful architecture and food and people. She didn't join the British air force, she had joined the French air force. She knew that that hadn't been the case before she had stepped back onto the transport, but the moment she had done something with the wand, everything had seemingly changed.

Finally she stopped in the middle of a hallway, and double checked to make sure no one else was around. She had to confirm that she wasn't going made. Perhaps she might open her mouth and that usual cockney tone would come out.

"Testzing, testzing," she said to herself, hand held to her throat. Her stomach dropped as soon as Widowmaker's voice fell from her lips. Not because it sounded wrong, but because it sounded right. She knew it wasn't her voice, yet again, if she thought about it she could have spoke fluent French on the spot.

She started down the hall again, not particularly thinking on her destination. It had to have been the wand. It glowed the moment she mentioned talking like Amelie, and then all of the sudden she spoke in Amelie's voice. The two had to have been connected. But that wasn't possible. Even Angela probably couldn't have come up with such a device, at least not one that could do so much in so little time. It was practically...Magic.

Before she could even realize, she had thrown open a door and stepped inside her little apartment at base, stopping in the entryway to try and steady her thoughts. She had to correct this, surely, but the thought of what the little wand was capable was almost intoxicating. Producing it from her pocket, she continued on into the apartment, setting it on a table near the entryway. Even out of her hand it was still on her mind, though not for much longer.

Another voice pulled her out of whatever plans she could make for using it. Off from the kitchen of the apartment she heard a short squeal, followed by a red head poking out from around a corner.

"I was wondering when you were getting back, Lena. Just in time, I've got tea about to come off."

Tracer stopped in her tracks, and stared for a moment. Emily didn't notice, pulling her head back around the corner. A moment later she emerged with a teapot and a pot holder, and set them both down on the counter. Two cups soon joined them, which were filled with tea, just as Tracer preferred.

Something clicked in her brain as she rounded the counter to embrace Emily, whispering into her as if on impulse, "My love, ze cavalry has returned."

Emily's face went as red as her hair as she snickered, hiding her bemusement behind her cup. "How was the mission?"

Mind racing, Tracer sauntered around the counter, picking up her tea cup. Forget the wand. This voice was intoxicating. Memories flashed of her using its lower, more seductive tones to woo Emily on countless occasions, and she started playing the part on instinct. Locking eyes with Emily, she took a sip of her tea, before adding "Oh, as per usual. I saved ze day vith a number of heroics, and captured ze villain."

Resting on the counter, Emily looked entranced as Tracer recounted the entire ordeal. Lena had to of course enhance a few sections of the story, and made sure to pepper spots with some wonderful French. When finally she finished, Lena took both of their tea cups to the sink to clink, wonder how she had ever lived without being able to have Emily so taken with her simply speaking.

Returning from the kitchen ready for round 2, Lena skidded to a halt the moment she saw Emily having moved beyond the counter. There was a confused look on her face as she looked over the wand, muttering to herself, "Where the heck'd this thing come from?"

Lena immediately retreated back to the kitchen, and began trying to plan out an explanation. From out in the living room she could hear Emily moving about, talking to herself, trying to suss out just where exactly the object had come from, a few other idle thoughts getting peppered along with them.

Finally Tracer felt prepared to retrieve the item, and stepped out of the kitchen.

She...
114213.title: Flirting with the French Language

1142131.content:
Tracer peeked out from the corner a few more times, formulating what she was going to say. How to play the wand off as some knick-knack they had picked up on the mission. She retreated for a final time, just barely missing the flash of light as the wand triggered based on some random thought from Emily.

Readjusting her glasses, Tracer took a deep breath. She was regretting not having taken her parka off at the door, not just because of how clunky and hot it felt, but how she had an inkling that it might have helped with 'negotiations'. As things stood though, she felt confidant enough. With Widowmaker's voice, she felt like she could have talked anything off of Emily, let alone that silly piece of wood.

Tracer zeroed in on Emily as fast as she could, trying to bring their budding conversation's focus to the wand right off the bat. "Oh, love. Did you that up by the door?"

Emily turned, wand still firmly in hand, at the sound of Lena calling to her. The smile on her face drooped down into a gobsmacked look of confusion soon after. Her head tilted this way and that, trying to find Tracer, only to settle in on what appeared to be...Mei.

"Ah, sorry," Emily began, trying to find her feet, "I didn' hear you come in Mei. Did you knock?"

It was Lena's turn to look confused. She looked this way and that, trying to find any sign of Mei and her usual orange leggings, but turned up with nothing. Gloved hands knitting together, Tracer gave Emily a concerned look. "Mei isn't here, love." Her eyes turned once again to the wand, trying to process if anything had changed. Far as she could tell, nothing had. But then again, neither had Widowmaker noticed when they had swapped voice.

Tracer shot through her memories again. She had always grown up in France, amidst a family of Chinese immigrants. It had felt a bit odd at times, but she had always considered Paris her home. Lena could still very much remember that the France part was a result of the swap from Widowmaker, but everything else seemed perfectly normal.

Emily stood there, eyes shooting between the wand and Tracer, jaw agape. She held the wand up...
1142131.title: A Chilling Encounter

11421311.content:
Tracer blinked, hadn’t she wanted to ask Emily something? Oh of course, she had wanted to know where Emily had gotten that odd trinket. Tracer had never seen anything like it, to her it looked like a ‘magic’ wand a witch might use. “Where’d you get that Emily? Ooh, are you going to cast a spell on me?” she asked, while putting some of her French charm into her voice. Emily’s blush encouraged Tracer to continue, she removed her thick gloves and stepped closer to her girlfriend.

“Oh this? I… found it… while you were gone today.”

Tracer giggled at Emily’s flustered response, “I’m just kidding love, let me change into something more comfortable and I’ll help you with dinner”. Lena pulled away and started toward their shared quarters.

“Oh uh, no worries I’m almost finished… just find something good for us to watch” was Emily’s reply, while Tracer playfully swayed her wide hips, giggling to herself.

Their bedroom was modestly appointed and quite small, space was a valuable commodity at the base. The bed was squeezed into the far corner, which allowed for just enough room to open the closet door to the side. Tracer’s eyes swept over the array of cold weather gear inside, before breathing a sigh of relief as she removed her heavy parka. She spent a few moments wrangling its bulk onto a hanger, then sat down to remove her thick boots. After finally untying her laces she moved to her dresser, intending to find her preferred pair of pajama pants.

Midway through her search she was startled by a sound behind her. Ah, it was just her orange jumpsuit, it must have slipped from the hanger. With a sigh she returned to the open closet, brushing past her dainty running shoes. Having replaced the garment, she moved back to dig for those pajamas, ‘the ones with the cute cats Emily loved’ thought Tracer. After fishing them out she made sure to find a comfortable shirt, ‘something that fits a little loose, just to mess with Emily’. Settling with another cat theme she slipped on the outfit and made for the door. She stopped just before leaving, a thought nagging at the back of her mind. “Oh of course” she murmured, returning to her bedside she bent to collect her metallic heels and greaves. She placed them in the closet below her iconic white armor, Emily always appreciated a neat bedroom. Tracer smiled, while adjusting her platinum blonde ponytail as she stepped into the hallway.
11421311.title: and swapped Tracer again.

choices: Eat dinner with Tracer like this.
114213111.content:
As Lena had made her way into their bedroom to relieve herself of 'her' parka, Emily had trailed behind, wand clutched firmly in her hands. Her eyes were as big as plates as she observed Tracer, looking completely like the local climatologist Mei-Ling Zhou. From head to toe, Tracer was Mei, in all but identity. From her glasses to her parka to her thick boots, Tracer was physically Mei. Emily's mind went wild with the possibilities. One idle thought with the wand had transformed Tracer.

Her second thought had removed any question she had about whether the wand was real or not. The moment she wondered what exactly it was Tracer had brought home, the wand had glistened brightly again, and in a moment she seemed to remember every moment Tracer had had with it. Bringing it off the ship, swapping Widowmaker's voice. And in turn, Tracer was clueless. She didn't know that Emily had done anything, and now she didn't even know that her French accent wasn't natural to her.

Emily had watched her remove the parka, before springing through a series of ideas. It was like watching a slideshow transition from that point. Where once Lena had looked like Mei, now she looked like Brigette, and was pulling out Brigette's cat pajamas to change into. Another thought turned her into Angela Ziegler, who she exited the room as, after adjusting her blonde hair like nothing was out of the norm. And yet her voice was still that borrowed French accent.

"Is there anything in particular you wanted to eat tonight, love?" Tracer asked as she passed by Emily, making for the kitchen.

"Whatever you feel like making," Emily said, trying to reel herself back into the conversation for a moment.

What a thought. She was in a relationship with Angela Ziegler in all but name. And personality, she supposed. She tapped her chin, following behind Lena. Watching from afar as she began working in the kitchen, Emily focused on her idea, and watched as the wand lit up again.

"Angela?" she called out from their living room.

On cue, 'Angela' looked up, "Yes, love?"

Emily ducked around the corner, amazed once more. "Nothing! I found what I was looking for." With another thought, she undid the change. Lena was once again Lena, even if she had the body of a German bombshell.

Tapping the wand against her chin, she pondered all the things she could do with it. Walking down and into the bathroom, she peered at herself in the mirror. At the moment, she was as she always had been. Thanks to her memories, she knew that Tracer hadn't had the opportunity to try the wand out on her. Same red hair, same freckles, same as ever. But with a flick of the wand...

She had to close her eyes. While she kept them shut, and imagined her idea, she tried to make herself believe that this wasn't real. That it was all a dream, or a fantasy, or a delusion. It took all her might to crack one eye open and confirm that it was real. The truth was right there in the mirror. What reflected back at her was no longer that freckled red-head, but instead a Korean eSports star. She stumbled backwards out of shock, eyes going wide when the reflection did the same. The wand clattered out of her hand and on to the floor as she rushed to the mirror, and began feeling her face, her now long brown hair, the tight body suit that she now wore. All of it was real.

"Wow," she said, hand going straight to her throat when she heard D.va's voice emerge, having traded everything.

A coy grin overtook her face, and she stepped back from the mirror, trying to mimic the poses she had seen D.va use before taking to the field. They all came naturally, as did the catchphrases that went with them. She didn't even realize that she had been talking to herself for a few minutes, until she took notice that the bathroom door was open. She stumbled away from it, noticing that Lena had been observing for some time, a bemused look on her face that Emily could never have imagined Angela making.

"Are you streaming tonight, love?"

As if on cue, Emily responded. "Thinking about it, yeah. Can't keep my fans waiting for too long." Just the fact that she knew exactly what all of this meant now astounded her. Without hesitation she felt like she could have named off every piece of her rig, and remember every tournament. Every battle in the meka.

"Well," Lena said, motioning towards the kitchen, "How about a nice meal beforehand?"

Emily nodded, "I'll be there in a moment."

Tracer seemed to accept this, and made her way back down the hall. Picking up the wand from where it had fallen on the floor, Emily gave herself another glance in the mirror. All of this was so thrilling, almost terrifyingly so. Perhaps it was time to reset everything back to zero. There were so many changes in play at the moment that she feared losing track of them all. And yet, at present she found the thought of streaming to her thousands of adoring fans rather appealing.

After a moment of contemplation, Emily decided to...
114213111.title: Pre-Meal Amusement

choices: went to go test the wand elsewhere.
1142132.content:
Zipping out of the kitchen, Tracer was at Emily's side in an instant. There was not a moment to lose, Emily could use the wand on accident at any time, and Lena would have been none the wiser.

Emily jumped at the sudden movement, wand leaving her hands for a moment as it shot into the air with her shock. Tracer casually snapped it out of the air, smiling. Recovering from the surprise, Emily looked between Tracer and the wand, "What is that thing?"

Tracer could only shrug, crooning, "It's just a piece we brought back from the mission, my love. Winston wanted me to bring it to him later, so you probably don't want to be messing with it." A little fib, a harmless one Tracer told herself.

Emily seemed to buy it, suddenly looking at the wand as though it were a snake that might bite her.

"Riiiight," she said, letting Lena keep the thing and slinking back into the kitchen, "Think I'll start supper."

Tracer just smiled and nodded, watching from afar as Emily began picking through cabinets for ingredients. An idea suddenly struck her, and she decided to...
1142132.title: A Way With Words

11421321.content:
Settling in on the couch in the den, Tracer made sure that she had a good view of Emily, while still being in plain view of the TV. When in doubt, she could just start flipping through channels to look distracted. Once she was certain that Emily was paying her no mind, Tracer turned her attention to the wand, and started racking her brains for ways to test it.

Struck with a moment of inspiration, she looked at Emily, face currently obscured as she poked through the fridge, and gave the wand a short wave. Lena had decided to stick to visible changes, she wouldn't exactly be able to hear Emily talking from here. Taking in a breath, she waited for Emily to emerge from the fridge, jaw dropping when she finally did.

The person cooking now was not, as far as Lena remembered, Emily. Instead standing there, still wearing Emily's sweater and pajama pants, was one Angela Ziegler. And Emily showed no sign of seeing any difference. She even adjusted her now blonde hair without a second thought, before returning to her cooking. It took Tracer a moment to recover from the shock of it all. Not just that the wand had worked, but what that now meant for her.

Angela had never really looked her age, and more than a handful of times Tracer had taken the time to appreciate her from afar. And now she was in a relationship with her. Or rather, in a relationship with someone who looked exactly like her. Meanwhile in some other part of the building Angela Ziegler was now walking around looking like Emily.

Deciding to continue fiddling with the wand, Tracer wracked her brain for another person to choose from, having so many options but unsure of who to pick. Watching Emily standing on her tiptoes to reach something on the upper part of their spice cabinet was all the inspiration she needed. With another flick of the wand, Emily was suddenly a Russian bodybuilder who had no issue reaching anything. Not missing a single beat, Emily continued cooking.

Meanwhile across the room, Tracer's heart was missing all kinds of beats. She was struggling to process everything she was seeing. Trying to take in the fact that Zarya was now standing in her kitchen, but was still Emily. Getting lost in the way her jumper barely seemed to contain her muscular form.

An idea suddenly struck Tracer, and once again she waved the wand. After the usual bright light, she leaned off from the side again, jaw dropping once more as she stared into the kitchen. As she had wished, the wand had swapped Emily with Widowmaker of all people. But the truly shocking thing for Tracer was how it had made that fit to reality. Emily certainly had Widowmaker's body, confirmed even more for Tracer with how her pants hugged her waste. But no longer was it the deep blue and purple that Tracer had seen so many times.

Emily still had Widowmaker's long hair, which instead of being pulled up was allowed to run down the entire length of her back. But rather than being blue, it was what had once been Amelie's natural hair color, black. Her skin was a normal tone as well. To complete the confusion, Emily gave a short warning that the food was almost ready, in Tracer's very own voice.

"Would you mind settin' the table luv?"

That sentence alone forced Tracer's brain to completely reboot. Not only had the wand given Emily Widowmaker's body, adjusted said body for the fact that she had never been forced to go through the ordeals that Amelie had, and Emily was none the wiser for all of it. It had given her the body as is, which meant that she still had Tracer's previous voice.

"I will join you in a moment, love," Tracer said.

She looked down at the wand, and up at Emily, deciding to...
11421321.title: On the Wings of an Angel(a)

choices: Impulsively Widow thought about having Winston's Strength.
Widow thought fast and used the wand to swap affiliations with Tracer.
Widow wished to be able to turn back time like Tracer.
Widow finds a chance to escape.
Widow submits and is taken to Overwatch HQ.
1143.content:
"Just right." Widowmaker said to herself as she assumed a ready position nestled on the roof of a large building. She had a large mark today, she was going to take out another Omnic politician.
Widow had laid, waiting for the mark to emerge from the spot far longer than she should have, he was supposed to leave the building twenty minutes ago. She scoped the window nearest the door, there she saw a smug woman sat indian-style wave at her. Seeing red she fired at the woman only for said woman to blink out of existance. "Stupid girl, wasting my time. She better make it up to me." Amelie said, repositioning, though she knew that girl would likely be behind her by now, just waiting to say—
"You missed!" A voice sang out behind Widow, "You would think by now you'd be used to my lead." Tracer taunted.
"You've saved the bot?"
"Of course I have! It's what Heroes do!" Tracer responded as she blinked in front of the blue woman. As soon as the blue faded Amelie did two things simultaneously she opened fire spraying bullets into the space Tracer had recently claimed and shot a gas mine to the spot Tracer previously stood.
A coughing was heard behind her, a smile spread on her face, proud of her guile she used her grapple and ran away. She jumped into an alley, she normally would stick the landing but her positioning was off her right foot landed on a small box before her left foot and she'd crumpled in a practiced motion to save her ankle. Amelie removed the box that was stuck to her heal, as she did so a wand fell into her lap.
"Who would box a scrap of wood?" the blue woman said as she grabbed it to toss it off her lap, or rather she would have if the wand hadn't assaulted her mind with information. "The Swap Wand?" Amelie said in a brief stupor before hearing the clambering of footsteps abover her.
Widow put the wand in her belt and grappled to the roof slingshotting herself into the air and sending a shot where the Tracer briefly stood. Unfortunately she didn't expect Tracer to charge the position she would land, nor for a monkey to bound through the air and grab her arms and hold them to her sides.
"Unhand me you monkey!" Widowmaker demanded upon their descent to the roof top.
"I don't think so, Amelie."
"Don't call me that—" Widowmaker started before biting her tongue, she needed to think of a way out. Her arms being held to her side left the tip of a certain wand within grasping distance, thoughts began broiling. Could the wand help her escape? Was it worth it to try to use it? Would it be better to be imprisoned in the Overwatch HQ, perhaps she could escape and bring some information for Talon.
1143.title: Widowmaker

11432.content:
Wand gripped tightly behind her back, the sniper allowed a single thought to permeate her head. Swapping affiliations with Lena 'Tracer' Oxton. She had been briefed on the wand's supposed abilities, but certainly didn't buy into any of it. If anything, she had scoffed at the thought that Talon would invest resources in it. But after a short flash of light, she found herself reconsidering that.

The first thing she noticed was that the gorilla was no longer holding her in place. Instead, his hand was gently resting on her shoulder, as if to comfort her.

"Excellent work as usual, Amelie," he said as he moved past her, looking down at someone just beyond her view.

She spent a moment gathering herself, going slackjawed when she noticed that her usual purple body suit was now colored a vibrant orange and white. Along the side of her legs she could see the Overwatch emblem, clear as day. Her rifle too had changed to a similar color scheme. Slinging it on her back, she finally stepped around Winston, only to find Pharah and Tracer, on much less friendly terms than they had been but a minute ago.

Tracer's hands were in cuffs, at the center of which was some sort of energy core. If Amelie was forced to guess, it was what was keeping the woman from zipping or rewinding away at the moment. What caught her eye next was the fact that Tracer too had received a wardrobe change. Her bomber jacket was now a deep black and red, the Talon logo resting on both her shoulder and the left breast of the jacket. She was giving Widowmaker a grim look, but remained silent as Pharah began to lead her back to the ship.

Winston too began to make for the ship, but not before turning to look at Widowmaker. "Coming, Amelie?"

Amelie stood there for a moment, considering her options. She could simply swap back now, and take the opportunity to flee. But now would be an amazing opportunity for infiltration. To be able to move about the Overwatch base unabated, with access to all of their documents. The thought was intoxicating.

She turned her head slightly, attention being grabbed away by a nearby window. Looking back at her was a face she hadn't seen in ages. One that wasn't purple, that had a natural hair color. Another, more selfish thought crossed her mind. Perhaps this reality was worth exploring more just for her sake.

Did she...
11432.title: Team Swap

choices: Amelie decides to punish Lena by swapping stuff between them.
Amelie decides to punish Lena by swapping her with others.
Amelie conjures another punishment for Lena.
Amelie in a moment of clarity realizes that she can't re-adapt to her old life.
Amelie calms herself down to do the "right" thing and let Due Process work.
114322.content:
Amelie banished the thought of being selfish. She may no longer be literally cold hearted, but her motives remained the same—at least that's what she told herself. She is simply going undercover, a spontaneous undercover operation. She smiled to herself and made her way onto the jet that pulled up near the building to receive the prisoner and Overwatch members.
Amelie had to hide her amazement as she entered the jet for the first time, surprised by its size and by how messy it was, photos thrown across a table, basketballs loosely secured on a rack and a basketball hoop in what she would have called an inconvenient place. It was new to her, but it felt like it safe to her, like a home.
"Nice ship, love." Tracer spoke from her restrained seat. "I kind of missed it, haven't been on it since, well you know," Tracer continued having now gotten Widow's full attention she wanted to know. "Turned against the whole operation, shot up certain individuals," Tracer sent a pointed glare at Amelie "Oh and earned my title: Widowmaker." Amelie was shocked, for several reasons, in this new reality she was not Widowmaker, she was just Amelie, she'd spent so long forgetting Amelie as Widow she felt she would have trouble returning to it, additionally she was hurt by those words, it seemed like the first time she'd felt such emotions. Amelie's teeth ground as she strode to the bound woman, blinded by having found emotion again. Amelie grabbed "Widowmaker's" face pointing it so their eyes were locked.
"I'd love nozing more zan to make you suffer." Amelie said with tight lips.
"Ha, under difference circumstances maybe I'd enjoy that." Lena retorted unfazed by the sniper's threat. "Unfortunately for you though, I'm taken."
Amelie was furious before, but now somehow she was even angrier. She wanted revenge, she thought for a second.
114322.title: Return to Overwatch HQ

choices: Explore the base, and perhaps swap a few operatives in the process.
1143225.content:
The moment she focused back on where she was, Amelie's anger subsided. She couldn't even imagine what she had to be angry with Lena for. Reality had changed and shifted so much, it was impossible to tell. It was certainly a genuine emotion, just not one she could actively identify the source of. Perhaps she would look into it later.

For the moment she opted to rest back in her seat, and took in the ship. It was odd to think she had free run of the entire thing, if she so wanted. She watched idly as a few of the other Overwatch members milled about, stowing their gear and mingling. Eventually Winston seemed to take notice of her by her lonesome, and approached.

"How did the rifle do today, Tracer?"

Amelie blinked, instinctively looking up at Winston, "Hm?"

The scientist pointed at the rifle on her back. "Your trace rifle. I know we didn't have time to test my adjustments before we were called away today."

Pulling the rifle from her back, Amelie examined it closer. At first she had only noticed the Overwatch color scheme the weapon had acquired, but with a longer look, she realized that it didn't seem to fire actual bullets now. The longer she thought about it, the more she realized that the rifle was non-lethal. It wasn't meant to harm a soul. And she also remembered Winston adjusting its tracer rounds earlier that day. She shuddered as her mind settled with these new memories, before regaining her composure.

"It shot true, Winston. Thank you."

Seeming satisfied, Winston returned to the others and their conversations. Across the seat from her, Amelie noticed Lena looking morbidly amused. Her usual wit didn't seem to be as active now. Instead it felt as though the look was supposed to invoke something in Amelie. She felt that anger stir again, but couldn't for the life of her place what the source of it was.

Sometime later the ship touched down at Overwatch HQ. Stepping off of the ramp, Amelie watched as Winston took Lena away, to ready her for a holding cell. The former member of Talon stared at the entrance to her enemy's headquarters. So much ground to play with.

She opted to...
1143225.title: A Calm Demeanor

choices: Spend some time with her Overwatch teammates.
Continue her assumed mission, and survey the base for Talon.
11432252.content:
That anger she felt was connected to Lena. Amelie was certain of it. The Brit's words cut deeper than they should have. She wanted to know why. Without having to ask it's location, Amelie made her way down hallways until she found herself in front of a terminal. The room she was now in was the Overwatch Records Room. She knew it, even if she had never visited it before. Because she had visited it numerous times in this altered reality. The thought made her head hurt.

Her fingers naturally clicked across keys for her login credentials. There was no second thinking as to what her password would be, everything just sprung to her as though she had known it her entire life, rather than learning it at this very moment. Navigating the records was just as easy, as was pulling the one up for Lena Oxton. She had looked at it countless times in this reality, and the thought of looking at it again filled her with dread.

The text of the file slowly lit up the screen.

Name: Lena Oxton
Age: 26
Affiliation: Talon

As the details slowly filled in, she knew exactly what they were going to say. Former fighter pilot who was part of an unfortunate accident that left her unstuck in time. Defected to Talon when they promised her a more permanent solution that Overwatch couldn't provide. After two weeks missing she returned unexpectedly, killed Gerard Lacroix, and vanished again.

Amelie's stomach dropped. To have experienced at the time was horrible, but now everything about the incident was flooding into her mind all at once. Gerard's body, his funeral. Her demands to take to the field to avenge him. Overwatch had helped her cope. Overwatch had given her a place to belong when everything she had was taken from her. And now her husband's murderer sat some floors above her.

She shouldn't care. It was all a fiction, as far as everything was concerned. A temporary way of things that would vanish when next she used the wand. And yet...

She swiveled in the chair, hand going for her rifle as the door behind her slid open. The rifle never left its holster, as she relaxed the moment she saw that it was Winston who had entered. The two remained silent as the scientist grew closer, looking over her shoulder at the screen. A knowing look crossed his face, and he looked more solemn than Amelie had ever seen him.

"I understand it must be hard to be so close to her, Amelie. But taking her in is the right thing to do."

She remained stiff, and stared at the floor. He was right. And she believed what he said. The fact that this wasn't permanent reiterated itself to her. Yet it didn't have to be temporary. Yet her duties to Talon...

"You are right, Winston," she said. "I believe I just need some...Time."

He nodded, resting a hand on her shoulder for a moment, before departing. She logged out of the terminal, and stood. Walking back down the hall, she decided to...
11432252.title: A Dark Dive into the Past

choices: Amelie tries to enjoy the moment with her allies
Amelie decides to rely on the wand for entertainment
Amelie decides the night deserves some reflection, and goes to her room
The wand wasn't warming to remind her, but was entertaining itself
114322521.content:
After a few minutes of contemplation Amelie decided to head towards the commons, either to lighten her mood amongst friends or spy on the enemy, she wasn't sure which—each seemed like the right answer. Amelie was split between two realities, the "real" reality where she was damned to a life of a cold widow, and a twisted reality where she could become something more. In the back of her mind she knew the longer she stayed the harder returning to her life would be, but at this moment returning to her life meant willingly entering captivity—which only added to the difficulty of making such a choice.
Amelie found herself before the door of the common area, it felt weird to have made it there so easily, but the door caused a warm feeling in her chest, in spite of never having entered the room she had a strong fondness towards it. She took a deep breath and crossed into the quasi-unknown.
"Ah, Amelie! Welcome back from another successful mission!" A bold, warm voice immediately assaulted the woman.
"Why thank you, Reinhardt. Your greetings are always a treasure." Amelie returned with a smile, as if she'd done this many times before. Behind that smile though the woman was barely concealing her horror, how could she be so familiar to this oafish man, and how could she be so nice to him?
"Winston had mentioned that you may have had a hard time today," A modulated voice came from her side, "One's duty is often hard, but those of strong character fulfill it well. Amelie," A robotic hand placed itself on her shoulder, "You certainly are strong." Amelie was looking into the eyes of the cyborg ninja, she for the first time saw the human part of the cyborg. The man's words made her feel much better.
"Thanks Genji, you've always manage to help me out of a rut." Amelie responded with a smile. Looking into the soft but serious eyes she saw a boy who'd suffered greatly, but matured quickly into a strong young man. Amelie felt as if she'd witnessed this growth, and to an extent envied it, he had forgiven the man who had destroyed his body, she couldn't do that for the woman who shot her husband, nor could she forgive those who had turned her into a cold killing machine... that thought trailed off as she realized the weight of that statement and swallowed it down, knowing she'll have to consider it more later.
Another person had snuck up to Amelie's side, "Here, your favorite." A glass of wine was offered to Amelie.
"Thanks—My god, I've become a jukebox, nothing more than a bunch of thankses." Amelie laughed. "You smother me with kindness."
"Of course, we're all here for you." Angela said guiding the woman to a seat. As they left Amelie turned to where the ninja had stood to find that he was gone, she found him once more at a ping pong table.
"Come on then you lousey xbox, game on!" A loud voice yelled at Genji whilst serving the ball. Junkrat and Roadhog were on site, Overwatch had overtime grown fond of the goons and their antics, they'd decided to hire them as demo specialists in an effort to curb their schemes not too long ago.
"Very well then." The "Xbox" returned the ball. "You two shall never beat me." He laughed.
I was as if Amelie's heart was melting, she loved everyone here even though she had been trying to kill and or maim many of them just weeks prior, even through this confusion she was, for lack of a better word, happy.
"Those boys, always having fun." A soft voice spoke from the seat next to Amelie.
"Oui. It's enviable, to have so much energy, I doubt nothing could keep those two down."
"You mean Fawkes and Mako?"
"Of course."
"I think if they were to be separated they'd have an incredibly hard time."
"I hope they never have to face such a reality." Amelie said, she watched them for a moment then turned back to Angela, "I wouldn't wish that on any two people." She said somberly.
"You always do this, work yourself into a sad mood." You'd really ought to live in the moment.
"You are right, the moment is the time to live." Amelie agreed, she looked back up at the woman across from her. Then she though about how to live in the moment, as if to remind her of it's existence wand warmed in her pocket.
114322521.title: Spend some time with her Overwatch teammates.

115.content: One more choice before it all starts!
115.title: Zarya, or a new character

12.content: The story can almost begin!
12.title: Is the character male?

121.content: This is your last choice, you sure about this?
121.title: Doomfist, Genji, or Hanzo

choices: Genji explores his new body first
Figure out what the wand is
1212.content:
Genji examined the artifact he now held in his hands, having just swiped it during an infiltration mission at a Talon base. He was back at Overwatch's HQ now, curiously studying the thing when Tracer popped her head in the doorway with a smile. "Genji! Whatchu got there, luv?" The british woman asked as she darted to his side. Genji chuckled and looked at her. "Hello, Lena. I was simply... checking out this strange object I uncovered on my last assignment." The ninja explained, a nagging urge now in the back of his mind since his friend had shown up, a compulsion of sorta that made him grip the object a bit tighter. Now he couldn't help but run his gaze over Tracer's form, her tight fitting suit on those nicely toned legs, the cute yet cool cut of her hair...

He was brought out of thought by the woman continuing. "Ah! Yeah, 's bit strange in'it? Looks like some kinda magic wand out of a movie! Spooky!" She remarked with her usual peppy enthusiasm. "Indeed." Genji simply responded, glancing back at Tracer once more. In that moment, the wand in his hand began to react, and very suddenly Genji felt something... shift. A blink, and he looked back to Tracer... only to find himself looking back at him! "W-what?!" He exclaimed in shock, with the person identical to him tilting their head in confusion. "Genji? Ya alright there, luv?" Genji felt his jaw slack in shock, looking down at himself suddenly. It was then he noticed... he wasn't exactly "himself" at the moment, garbed out in Tracer's outfit and more notably, her very body. "Lena? Why do I look... like you..." Genji began to ask, but trailed off. It was weird hearing Tracer's voice as he spoke, especially since it lacked her distinct English accent when he wielded it. Almost as if responding to that thought, he felt the artifact react again. The person he presumed to be Tracer (in his own body) again looked very confused. "What are you saying? You look the same as always!" This time his own body lacked Tracer's accent, replaced with his own.

That was odd, he had exchanged bodies with her, even distinct traits, yet only he noticed. He looked down at the artifact in his hands and suddenly put two and two together. "Ah... r-righto. I must be... knackered, from that last mission. Sorry." Genji responded, now with Tracer's usual tone of speech naturally falling out of his mouth like he'd spoken that way his entire life. Tracer simply shrugged and began to walk away. "Alright, let me know if you require anything." She said over her shoulder before vanishing through the doorway. Now that he was alone, Genji quickly unbuckled the chrono-device and let it fell to the ground, removing Tracer's goggles from her head as well. He stared down at his now smaller, more petite gloved hands with his mouth gawking in awe. "Blimey."
1212.title: Genji

choices: Genji swaps more things with Tracer
He finds somebody else to use it on
12121.content:
This was like something out of some kind of... manga, for lack of a better comparison. Genji sat there, now the owner of his friend's physical form, with apparently not a single drawback as far as he could tell. "Amazing..." He noted aloud, still staring at his new hands in awe. Honestly, he'd almost forgotten what it was like to have a REAL body again, not stuck as part machine. As much as he had come to accept himself as was, perhaps subconsciously he was jealous of his friend in that moment, and that's why this... wand reacted the way it did, like it had for their speech.

Genji removed as much of Tracer's armor as he could, finally unzipping the bomber jacket and revealing what was underneath... more of the same orange suit, which was apparently made like some kind of leotard. Of course, that meant he was also looking at Tracer's... his, chest. And what a chest it was. Contrary to her lean frame, Lena Oxton had quite the bust. Made sense, given how bulky her jacket always looked from the front, even without her chronal device on. Peeling off the gloves, Genji wasted no time bringing his hands to his newly acquired assets. "Blimey... again." He was still slightly thrown off by this new voice, but even more so at how natural the dialect felt on his tongue. It's like he really was Tracer, in a weird way. His hands slowly caressed the large mounds of flesh, taking fascination in how they felt when they were attached to him for a change.

He threw off the jacket and peeled the top of the suit off, now standing in a bright orange bra that matched the look of her overall aesthetic. "Bloody hell, I'm proper stacked!" Genji said with a grin as his hands slipped underneath the cups to grab at his flesh more directly. Now that he thought about it, he was probably the only man who'd ever gotten his hands on Lena in such a way... even if he was using her hands to do so. His fingers pinched a nipple, and he bit his lip as a moan slipped out. "This is how the other half lives, eh?" The man-turned-woman said with a cheeky grin as his hands pulled free and he re-adjusted the bra, taking a moment to trace his hands over the cups to feel their fabric. "Think I could learn t' live with this!" He finished that thought with a grab of that strange wand again, deducing that it must have some ability to read his desires to a degree, and change people to suit them.
12121.title: Genji explores his new body first

121211.content:
Well he'd already taken her body, and even the way she talks. What else was there? She seemed to still address him as Genji, despite all evidence to the contrary, so clearly he couldn't actually get away with claiming himself to actually be her to others... unless of course, he could social status to the point where they'd effectively traded lives entirely? "Hm, yeah... That sounds good." Genji said with a grin, putting what he could of Tracer's stuff back on, before using her powers to zip around and find his original body.

It only took a moment, which Genji ended up enjoying immensely. He was fast all right, but this was almost true super speed! It felt amazing! "Lena!" He called out to his friend with his old form. "Hm?" The woman turned to him at his call. "Genji, what is it?" She asked him with a sincere tone, she really couldn't tell a thing. Genji smiled, gripping the wand behind his back and prepare to let it work it's magic. "I was just thinking, sometimes I really wonder what it would be like, y'know, to really BE Tracer. To live your life." At that statement, he felt the wand react again, and knew that by the time she'd respond, things had changed again. "Well, you have a wonderful life, Lena. I wouldn't trade it if I were you." Tracer said in response, only for Genji to grin a wide grin. It actually worked! They'd swapped names, at the very least. He needed to test how much got transferred over. "S'pose you're right. Got that wonderful bird back home and all." He prompted, to which she only nodded. "Emily is lucky to have you, truly."

This was amazing, he'd 100% usurped somebody else's life! He just had to go explore more about this, and speaking of "his" lovelife... "Too true, well! That's all really, be seein' you... Genji." He said with a salute, dashing out of there.
121211.title: Genji swaps more things with Tracer

122.content: This is your last choice, you sure about this?
122.title: Junkrat, Lucio, or McCree

choices: The duo is cut off before escaping
1221.content:
Numbani Heritage Museum

It was just another heist for the duo of Junkrat and Roadhog. Break in, grab the loot, blow it all up as they made their grand escape. Except this time, they didn't know exactly what this loot was. Only that it was 'a secret powerful treasure, said to be able to bend reality'...

"Sound like bullshit." Was all Roadhog said about it in his usual muffled voice, after Junkrat's explanation on what they were after.

"No, no no. See, that's wat they want ya to b'lieve." Junkrat started. "But me? I know a few things bout treasure. Ye gotta trust me mate, ain't nothin' betta then a treasure that gets em all talkin'."

"Hmph." Roadhog looked at all the bombs set up at the wall. Sure, he thought the idea was still really dumb and the prize was as well. But he's going to go along with it.

"Bomb's all set! Ehehehe..." Junkrat readied the detonator, giggling like a child during Christmas... or like himself when he had explosives at hand. "Fire in the hole!"

The bombs blew a hole in the wall in a deafening explosion, the shockwave rumbling through the complex.

"Now that's what I call an explosion! Ehehehe.." Junkrat laughed.

"Let's go." Roadhog said, walking towards the hole, Junkrat hobbling behind him. The alarms meanwhile quickly sounded, putting the two on the timer. Once through the wall, they found themselves surrounded by artifacts and paintings.

"Don't see your treasure." Roadhog noted, seeing mostly just more of the usual loot than anything 'reality bending'.

"Right, w-well, lets just grab and bag." Junkrat said, grabbing and stuffing whatever looked valuable into a bag. Roadhog did the same, just grabbing a looting. Soon enough, the sound of vehicles were approaching, and the duo knew they needed to go.

"Lets go." Roadhog said, making his way out the hole they came in.

"Just hold on a little longer, I've spotted something." Junkrat saw at the corner of his eye something that stood out to him. It was just a stick - well, a wand rather - but it drew in the rat to take it. He grabbed it, and followed behind Roadhog to make their grand escape...
1221.title: Junkrat

12211.content:
As the duo was making their escape, they were quickly intercepted by a streak of blue. It was of course, Tracer, here to stop the duo from their robbery.

"Hey, whatchu got there? Don't look like its yours." She confronted Junkrat and Roadhog.

"Mind yer own business." Roadhog said, quickly firing off his trusty scrap gun at the speedy Brit. Tracer quickly blinked away, and took out her two pulse pistols. The duo made a run for it, both firing off their weapons. Junkrat's grenades bounced around unpredictably, though Tracer skillfully dodged the bouncing explosives that headed her way.

"Aaargh! She's too quick!" Junkrat shouted as none of his shots hit.

"Come on!" Tracer blinked around a few times, before firing a volley that disarmed Junkrat of his grenade launcher. "Take that!"

Junkrat looked over to where his weapon flew, and saw that Tracer was already around it. If only I could get some of her speed...

All of the sudden, the wand started to glow and reacting to Junkrat's current desire. He felt his legs tingle a bit. Wait. Legs? He looked down and realized he suddenly had two legs again. Before he could examine further, he hear and saw Tracer trip and fall, a consequence of now having one of Junkrat's peg legs (and his other leg).

"Wait, what?" Tracer said on the ground, now quite processing what just happened.

"Let's move." Roadhog said, taking the opportunity to flee. Junkrat quickly grabbed his weapon of the ground, and ran along side his partner, excited about his discovery.

"Did you not see Roadhog? This is what the treasure is!" Junkrat exclaimed excitedly, showing Roadhog the wand as he ran along side.

"The stick?" Roadhog replied, clearly skeptical.

"Yes yes yes! Did ya not see me legs?"

"What of em?"

"I got two mate, yer eyes workin' okay?"

"You always had two."

"Ahahaha, so that's what the 'reality bend' is all about. That cunt back er, got me ol' peg, and you ain't eve see." Junkrat concluded with laughter.

"Hmph?" Roadhog made a clearly confused noise.

"Ah Roadhog, I'll show ya in due time mate."

"Hmmmph."

The two reached the hovertruck they had set up for escape...
12211.title: The duo is cut off before escaping

choices: Later in Junkrat and Roadhog's hideout
122111.content:
Just as they got to the truck, they were once again intercepted. From behind came Tracer, now slightly gimped on mobility from the swap. The the way the wand worked meant that she was able to adapt to her new handicap quickly. That was not all however, as backup came in the form of a pink mech, flying in from the sky. The Rules of the Wand:
1. The wand demands it be used, very few people can hold it and not want to use it. Though the wand is not good or evil, it encourages the user's inner desires whether they desire curves, status, skills, or vengeance.
2. The wand will always leave the targets in the positions they were in. IE when swapping bodies, the bodies will move, not the person inhabiting it.
3. The wand can swap anything that can be defined as a trait, whether it be physical or mental. It can swap skin tones, body parts, articles of clothing, friends, and skills. The wand is capable of making multiple swaps at a time.
4. The wand will adjust clothing to fit the body it is swapped to, but only alters clothing when the clothing is the target of a swap.
5. The wand by default leaves only the wielder aware of the swaps, the exception being if the wielder wants the victim to know of it. The wand also knows the wielder's intent, if the swap is done maliciously the wand may make it so the target is aware of the swap, but unable to comprehend why, or talk about it.
